body:
Before the start of the process (also known as solicitor-led negotiation) your lawyer will set up a meeting to discuss the case with you. You’ll need to explain what your issues are and the outcome you want to achieve.

After receiving instructions from you, your lawyer will begin negotiations with the other parent or their lawyer. You won’t have to deal directly with the other parent at any time.

As in [collaborative law]({app:urls:route:collaborative_law}) both lawyers will try and keep the case from going to court.

Your lawyer will usually draw up a document once they reach an agreement that you and the other parent are happy with. If you want to make the agreement legally binding they’ll submit it to court for consideration and approval.
cost_description: Fees may vary depending on your location and the experience of the lawyer. How long you need will depend on your situation. Some lawyers offer free 30-minute consultations or you can [check if you can get free legal help](https://www.lawworks.org.uk/legal-advice-individuals).
heading: Lawyer negotiation process
